arm_group.arm_group_label: no assessment of motorfunction in PACU
arm_group.description: no assessment of motorfunction after spinal anesthesia in PACU
Assesment of motorfunction after spinal anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock:
The study investigates the safety of discharge from the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU)
      without assessment of motorfunction after spinal anesthesia for total hip- or knee
      replacement. This is an randomized controlled trial between two groups with assessment of
      normal (Aldrete) PACU discharge criteria with or without assessment of the motorfunction.
      The study hypothesis is that it is safe to be discharged from the PACU to a ward without
      assessment of motor function.T The main outcome is length of hospial stay (LOS) in days and
      re-admission within the first 90 days after surgery .

      Secondary outcomes include adverse events up to 24 hours after surgery, and minuttes spent
      in the PACU after surgery.

      Participants will be monitores for adverse events for the first 24 hours after surgery and
      reported. The total number of minuttes spent in the PACU will be recorded and reported.

clinical_study.brief_title: PACU Discharge Without Motorfunction Assessment After Spinal Anaesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age 18 yr or more

          -  primary unilateral total hip or knee arthroplasty

          -  spinal anesthesia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  intraoperative conversion to general anesthesia

          -  intraoperative bleeding exceeding 750 ml.

intervention.description: assessment of motorfunction in PACU after spinal anesthesia

clinical_study.official_title: PACU Discharge Without Motorfunction Assessment After Spinal Anaesthesia for Total Hip or Knee Arthroplasty - a Multicenter Randomized Controlled Trial

other_outcome.description: Time from arrival to discharge i PACU measured in minuttes
How many patients fulfilled the PACU discahrge criteria at the time they were leaving the operating theater
other_outcome.measure: Discharge readiness before leaving the operating theater

primary_outcome.description: The main outcome is a compund measure of the duration of hospitalization after operation )measured in days, and named Length of Stay LOS) adn/or re-admission within the first 90 days after discharge.
primary_outcome.measure: Lenght of stay (in days) or 90 day readmissions

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Any event that results in a physicians assessment of the patient, not including regular rounds during the first 24 hours after surgery.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
